name: num::nonzero::NonZero::<i8>::abs

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

num::<impl i8>::abs.doc:
Computes the absolute value of `self`.

 # Overflow behavior

 The absolute value of
 cannot be represented as an
 and attempting to calculate it will cause an overflow. This means
 that code in debug mode will trigger a panic on this case and
 optimized code will return
 without a panic. If you do not want this behavior, consider
 using [`unsigned_abs`](Self::unsigned_abs) instead.

 # Examples

 ```
 ```

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecke.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.
